nodes.bodyText: I would make this constructor protected to prevent misuse, but still have available in tests.
for completeness, should we add a test for prefixLength? e.g. bytes=100-?
I recommend making all variables private final

instead of defining a boolean isSuffixLength, I think we can set either start or end to -1 to represent that they are unspecified, then just check for start < 0 to replace the isSuffixLength condition. This prevents misuse of the class or potentially specifying the wrong boolean parameter. We can add a private method for it.
private isSuffixLength() { mStart < 0; }
as a defensive measure, I would use >= mUnderlyingLength in the case the logic (whether now or in the future) ever goes over the mUnderlyingThreshold
